alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Bath and central Fleming Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elizaville, or near Flemingsburg, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Flemingsburg, Craintown and Pecks Ridge around 415 PM EDT. Tilton around 425 PM EDT. Poplar Plains and Pebble around 430 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Goddard, Wallingford, Oakley and Hillsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
